userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: Property rights reside with the repository. Literary rights reside with the creators of the documents or their heirs. To obtain permission to publish or reproduce, please contact the Public Services Librarian of the Dept. of Special Collections.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation:
prefercite.p: [Identification of item] Anton Francesco Montauti Papers, M0320, Dept. of Special Collections, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Abbot Marquis Anton Francesco Montauti was special envoy to the court at Vienna for the Grand Duke of Tuscany, Cosimo III (son of Ferdinand II) from March 24, 1670 to October 31, 1723.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Ciphers, letters, official patents, documents, and one drawing collected by Montauti while special envoy. Letters include chancellery letters of Cosimo III and Francesco Panciatichi, as well as letters of various royal and church personages.

did.unittitle: 1 lin ft (2ACO 451 items. Received in MSS 4/19/77. From Renzo Rizzi, Milan per Wm. P. Wreden. No restrictions.
Archive of the Abbot Marquis Anton Francesco Montauti, Special envoy to the court at Vienna for the Grand Duke of Tuscany, Cosimo III (Son of Ferdinand II) from March 24, 1670 to Oct. 31, 1723.

15 official patents of different personages and passports issued to Montauti (sealed and signed) on the part of Innocence XII, Clement XI, Cosimo III, Leopold I, Francesco Panciatichi, John III, King of Poland, etc.
47 chancellery letters signed (all rather long with many figures) and 5 ALS by Cosimo III of Tuscany.
55 letters (for the most, chancellery and signed) of Francesco Panciafichi.

scopecontent.p: Giovanni Guglielmo Elettore, Prince Matlia, Sigismondo Vescovo, Prince of Trento, Contersa Palatina del Reno, Princess of Tuscany, Apollonio Bassetti, Giovanni Gastone de Medici, Cardinal de Medici, etc.

did.unittitle: 26 AL of G.G. Kuzan of Prague.
11 AL of Brother Gersodus Capucine with correspondence from Reichstadt.
33 copies of letters, dispatches, memos, in German.
172 copies of documents regarding for the most part the marriage of Giovanni Gastone.
Domain of Licciana Nardi in Massa Carrara

scopecontent.p: 27 documents, mostly concerning the transfer of the area between Malaspina and Cosimo III. Several were [private secret [?]] by Montauti.
